jyzer.items
Class ConstantPool

java.lang.Object
  jyzer.items.ConstantPool

public final class ConstantPool
extends java.lang.Object

Gee, this class is one of the most important classes in this program. In general, the constant_pool is a table of structures representing various string constants, class and interface names, field names, methodreferences and other constants that are referred to within the ClassFile structure and its substructures. The format of each entry is indicated by its first "tag" byte.
The pool is indexed from 1 to constant_pool_count-1.

TODO: find a better datastructure for improve access/creation efficency.

TODO: implement the logging if a wrong index is given to the static getters.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Legendi Richard Oliver

Constructor Detail

ConstantPool

public ConstantPool(java.io.DataInput di)
             throws java.io.IOException
The constructor, creates a new instance of ConstantPool. Builds up the table with creating the necessary entries.

Parameters:
di - an opened input (should be a DataInputStream, but can be exchanged with any subclass).
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

getMethodReturnString

getMethodName

public static java.lang.String getMethodName(int index,
                                             java.lang.String enclosingClass)
Gets the name of a given method described by an Utf8 entry in the pool. The name of the enclosingClass is needed to give back the same name if the method is a constructor. That can be detected if the name equals to "". Accessed from MethodInfo.

Parameters:
index - index of a CONSTANT_Utf8_info structure.
enclosingClass - the name of the enclosing class.
Returns:
the name of the method.

getMethodParamsString

public static java.lang.String getMethodParamsString(int index)
Gets the parameters of a given method described by an Utf8 entry in the pool.

Parameters:
index - index of a CONSTANT_Utf8_info structure.
Returns:
the formal parameters of a method in a string.

getSignatureString

public static java.lang.String getSignatureString(int index)
Gets the signature of a given method described by a ConstantNameAndTypeInfo entry in the pool. These are not member methods, but methods that are invoked during the execution of the code like "System.out.println(...)".

Parameters:
index - index of a CONSTANT_NameAndType_info structure.
Returns:
the signature of the method (return type + name + parameters).

getDescriptorString

public static java.lang.String getDescriptorString(int index)
Returns the descriptor (type) of a field, or the type of a parameter of a function.

Parameters:
index - index of a CONSTANT_Utf8_info structure.
Returns:
the formal parameters of a method in a string.

Returns the name of the class described by the given CONSTANT_Class_info.

Parameters:

Returns:
the formal parameters of a method in a string.

getValueString

public static java.lang.String getValueString(int index)
Returns the value stored in the structure of the given index. The structure could be either a CONSTANT_Long_info, CONSTANT_Float_info, CONSTANT_Double_info, CONSTANT_Integer_info or a CONSTANT_String_info.

Parameters:
index - index of a structure (see above).
Returns:
the formal parameters of a method in a string.

getElement

public static ConstantPoolInfo getElement(int index)
Returns the element at the given index of the constant_pool.

getConstantPoolData

public java.lang.String[][] getConstantPoolData()
To get the information to the Constant Pool pane, to fill up the table.

Returns:
the array of string to fill a table.

getHTMLDescription

public void getHTMLDescription(java.lang.StringBuilder sb)
Concatenates a HTML string that represents this class ( looks cool! ) to the end of the given StringBiulder object. Using this method for improve efficiency, cause I had a lot of problems with displaying such a long HTML text in an EditorPane.

Parameters:
sb - a StringBuilder that contains the string representation of the full classfile.
